Title: Tesla offers China-made electric vehicles for sale in Canada
Short Description: Tesla is listing China-made Model 3 and Model Y models for sale in Canada, the company’s website showed on Tuesday, confirming the electric car maker has completed its first shipments to North America from its Shanghai factory.

Title: Tesla offering discounts of over $1,300 on some U.S. Model 3 cars
Short Description: Tesla is offering discounts of more than $1,300 on some Model 3 cars in its U.S. inventory following even heavier discounts in Europe, according to a Reuters' review of its website, at a time when the electric carmaker has raised U.S. prices on most newly ordered cars this month.

Title: Tesla 'serious' on establishing India production, innovation base, minister says
Short Description: Tesla Inc is "serious" about its plans to establish a manufacturing base in India, the country's deputy minister for technology told Reuters in an interview on Friday, a day after meeting senior executives of the electric vehicle maker.

Title: Tesla held talks with India on auto incentives, battery making
Short Description: Tesla Inc has held discussions with officials about incentives being offered by India for car and battery manufacturing, said a person with direct knowledge of the talks, as the automaker looks anew at entering the Indian market.

Title: Analysis: Elon Musk's embrace of advertising at Tesla grabs marketers' attention
Short Description: With Elon Musk outlining plans for Tesla Inc to use traditional advertising for the first time, viewers might see the electric-vehicle maker's Model Y crossover or upcoming Cybertruck pickup - maybe even the billionaire CEO himself - on TV or online.

Title: Tesla’s governance autopilot heads for disaster
Short Description: Portraying a CEO as a father figure is one way to tell there’s a lack of judicious oversight. Backing the company’s board despite obvious shortcomings is another. Tesla shareholders did both on Tuesday, with one of them playing the part of boss Elon Musk’s “son,” a robot the electric-car maker is developing, and many others again ignoring qualms about director nominees raised by proxy advisory firms Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) and Glass Lewis. The corporate governance neglect is troubling.

Title: Tesla restarts India market talks with new factory proposal
Short Description: Tesla Inc has proposed setting up a factory in India to build electric cars for domestic sale and export, the carmaker told government officials on Wednesday, according to a source with direct knowledge of the matter.

Title: Elon Musk reverses course and says Tesla will advertise its cars
Short Description: Tesla Inc boss Elon Musk, who has never used traditional advertising to sell cars, said on Tuesday that the automaker would try it and see whether it produced results.

Title: Tesla to meet Indian officials this week, source says
Short Description: Senior Tesla Inc executives will meet Indian government officials on Wednesday and Thursday to discuss local procurement of parts and other issues, a source with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

Title: Elon Musk says Tesla not immune to tough economy that he foresees
Short Description: Tesla Inc CEO Elon Musk warned on Tuesday that the electric-vehicle maker was not immune to the global economy, which he said will be difficult for the next 12 months.

Title: Tesla applies to expand Shanghai plant, add pouch battery cell output
Short Description: Tesla Inc has applied for regulatory clearance to expand its Shanghai plant and to begin producing for the first time pouch-type battery cells, albeit in small numbers.

Title: Musk tells Tesla staff he must approve all hiring - memo
Short Description: Tesla Inc CEO Elon Musk has said that the company can make no new hires unless he personally approves them, including contractors, according to a copy of the email seen by Reuters.

Title: Elon Musk loses bid to end SEC 'muzzle' over tweets
Short Description: A federal appeals court on Monday rejected Elon Musk's bid to modify or end his 2018 securities fraud settlement with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission that required a Tesla Inc lawyer to approve some of his tweets in advance.

Title: Analysis: Tesla’s new car-making process stokes debate among industry experts
Short Description: Tesla's new vehicle-assembly system ignited a debate on whether CEO Elon Musk's so-called unboxed process is radical, revisionist or derivative - or all of the above.

Title: Samsung Elec, Tesla heads meet to discuss cooperation in high-tech
Short Description: Samsung Electronics Executive Chairman Jay Y. Lee met with Tesla CEO Elon Musk last Wednesday to discuss ways to cooperate in future high-tech industries, Samsung said on Sunday.

Title: Tesla owners sue over impact of software update on EV batteries
Short Description: A group of U.S. Tesla Model S and Model X owners filed a proposed class-action lawsuit against the electric vehicle maker in California Friday over automatic software updates that reportedly decreased driving range or cause battery failures.

Title: Tesla may gain as Musk's Twitter distraction to ease
Short Description: Elon Musk's selection of a new CEO for Twitter may remove a big distraction for the billionaire and allow him to focus more on Tesla Inc, which has been struggling with a drop in demand for its electric vehicles, analysts said.

Title: Tesla to recall over 1.1 million foreign and China-made cars - Chinese regulator
Short Description: Tesla Inc will recall a total of 1,104,622 vehicles, both imported and China-made ones, China's market regulator said on Friday.

Title: Tesla raises US prices for all its vehicles except Model 3
Short Description: Tesla Inc increased the U.S. prices of its Model S, X, and Y electric vehicles by low single-digit percentages on Thursday, though prices were still considerably lower than at the beginning of the year.

Title: Tesla raises US prices
Short Description: Tesla Inc late on Thursday increased the U.S. prices of some of its electric vehicle models, according to its website. (Reporting by Shivani Tanna in Bengaluru; Editing by Varun H K)

Title: Elon Musk's bid to end tweet pre-approval faces skeptical court
Short Description: A federal appeals court on Thursday questioned Elon Musk's bid to end an agreement that he made to get a Tesla Inc lawyer's preapproval of some of his tweets, with judges pointing out that he agreed to it as part of a 2018 deal with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission...

Title: Elon Musk's bid to end tweet pre-approval faces skeptical court
Short Description: A federal appeals court on Thursday questioned Elon Musk's bid to end an agreement that he made to get a Tesla Inc lawyer's preapproval of some of his tweets, with judges pointing out that he agreed to it as part of a 2018 deal with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.

Title: Panasonic delays production of new Tesla battery to improve performance
Short Description: Panasonic said on Wednesday that it will delay the commercial production of its 4680 battery cells championed by Tesla CEO Elon Musk and begin operations during the April to September period in 2024, later than previously scheduled, as the company aims to improve their performance...

Title: Panasonic delays production of new Tesla battery to improve performance
Short Description: Panasonic said on Wednesday that it will delay the commercial production of its 4680 battery cells championed by Tesla CEO Elon Musk and begin operations during the April to September period in 2024, later than previously scheduled, as the company aims to improve their performance.

Title: Ex-Tesla worker seeks third trial in race bias case after $3.2 million award
Short Description: A Black former Tesla Inc factory worker has accused the electric automaker's lawyers of "egregious misconduct" after a jury awarded him $3.2 million in a race bias case, and asked for a third trial so he can seek more money.

Title: Ex-Tesla worker seeks third trial in race bias case after $3.2 mln award
Short Description: A Black former Tesla Inc factory worker has accused the electric automaker's lawyers of "egregious misconduct" after a jury awarded him $3.2 million in a race bias case, and asked for a third trial so he can seek more money.

Title: Tesla says its Texas factory hits output of 5,000 Model Ys per week
Short Description: Tesla said on Tuesday that its Texas factory achieved production of 5,000 Model Y vehicles per week, meaning that it would be able to produce about 260,000 of the vehicles annually.

Title: Tesla says its Texas factory hits output of 5,000 Model Ys per week
Short Description: Tesla said on Tuesday that its Texas factory achieved production of 5,000 Model Y vehicles per week, meaning that it would be able to produce about 260,000 of the vehicles annually.

Title: Elon Musk and Tesla break ground on massive Texas lithium refinery
Short Description: Tesla Inc on Monday broke ground on a Texas lithium refinery that CEO Elon Musk said should produce enough of the battery metal to build about 1 million electric vehicles (EVs) by 2025, making it the largest North American processor of the material.

Title: Tesla plans to produce lithium for 1 mln vehicles from Texas refinery -Elon Musk
Short Description: Tesla expects to produce lithium for about 1 million vehicles at its upcoming lithium refinery factory in Texas, CEO Elon Musk said at the plant's ground-breaking ceremony on Monday. (Reporting by Hyunjoo Jin and Ernest Scheyder Editing by Chris Reese)

Title: Seven US senators raise concerns about Tesla use of forced arbitration clauses
Short Description: A group of seven U.S. senators on Monday questioned Tesla Inc's use of forced arbitration clauses in employee and consumer contracts, arguing that they prevent bringing discrimination claims and consumer safety complaints to court.

Title: Seven US senators raise concerns about Tesla use of forced arbitration clauses
Short Description: The senators argue the clauses prevent bringing discrimination claims and consumer safety complaints to court.

Title: Seven US senators raise concerns about Tesla use of forced arbitration clauses
Short Description: A group of seven U.S. senators on Monday questioned Tesla's use of forced arbitration clauses in employee and consumer contracts, arguing that they prevent bringing discrimination claims and consumer safety complaints to court.

Title: Tesla's April sales of China-made EVs down 14.7% from March, China Passenger Car Association says
Short Description: Tesla Inc delivered 75,842 China-made electric vehicles (EVs) in April, down 14.7% from March, data from the China Passenger Car Association (CPCA) showed on Friday.

Title: Tesla raises prices for new Model S, Model X in China
Short Description: Tesla Inc has raised prices for its new Model S and Model X vehicles in China by 19,000 yuan ($2,751), its website showed on Friday.

Title: Tesla raises prices for new Model S, Model X in China
Short Description: Tesla Inc has raised prices for its new Model S and Model X vehicles in China by 19,000 yuan ($2,751), its website showed on Friday.

Title: ISS recommends Tesla investors vote against re-election of board chair
Short Description: Proxy advisory firm ISS on Wednesday recommended Tesla investors vote against the re-election of board chair Robyn Denholm, citing concerns about a lack of scrutiny of the pledging of some company stocks by CEO Elon Musk and his brother Kimbal Musk.

Title: Tesla resumes US orders for Model 3 long-range version at lower price
Short Description: Tesla Inc has resumed taking orders for its Model 3 long-range version in the United States, the company's website showed late on Tuesday, after a temporary halt last year due to delivery backlogs.

Title: Tesla resumes US orders for a Model 3 version at lower price, range
Short Description: Tesla Inc has resumed taking orders for its Model 3 long-range vehicle in the United States, the company's website showed late on Tuesday, after a temporary halt last year due to delivery backlogs.

Title: Tesla hikes US prices for second time in two weeks
Short Description: Tesla Inc raised its prices in the United States for the second time in less than two weeks, its website showed, after having slashed prices six times this year through mid-April.

Title: Tesla raises prices in US, China, Japan and Canada
Short Description: Tesla Inc has raised prices in a range of up to $290 in Canada, China, Japan and the United States, its website showed on Monday, after the company slashed prices of its top-selling vehicles since the start of the year.

Title: Tesla hikes U.S. prices
Short Description: Tesla Inc late on Monday increased the U.S. prices of some of its electric vehicle models, according to its website. (Reporting by Akriti Sharma in Bengaluru; Editing by Rashmi Aich)

Title: Tesla Models S, X unavailable in some Asia-Pacific countries, website shows
Short Description: Tesla's Model S and Model X were not available for order in some Asia-Pacific countries, including Australia, Thailand, Singapore and New Zealand, the automaker's website showed on Sunday.

Title: Tesla Models S, X unavailable in some Asia-Pacific countries, website shows
Short Description: Tesla's Model S and Model X were not available for order in some Asia-Pacific countries, including Australia, Thailand, Singapore and New Zealand, the automaker's website showed on Sunday.

Title: Tesla Model S and X not available for order in Australia, website shows
Short Description: Tesla Inc.'s Model S and Model X were not available for ordering in Australia, the automaker's website showed on Sunday. (Reporting by Akanksha Khushi in Bengaluru; Editing by William Mallard)

Title: Glass Lewis recommends vote against Tesla board nominee JB Straubel
Short Description: Proxy advisory firm Glass Lewis recommended Tesla Inc shareholders vote against board nominee JB Straubel at the electric carmaker's annual meeting next month, raising concerns regarding his independence.

Title: Stellantis' Tavares: no intention of starting a price war with Tesla
Short Description: Car maker Stellantis has no intention of starting a price war with Tesla, its CEO Carlos Tavares said on Thursday.

Title: Elon, or deepfake? Musk must face questions on Autopilot statements
Short Description: A California judge on Wednesday ordered Tesla CEO Elon Musk to be interviewed under oath about whether he made certain statements regarding the safety and capabilities of the carmaker’s Autopilot features.

Title: Elon Musk talks AI, Tesla with Democratic leader Schumer
Short Description: Elon Musk, the billionaire CEO of electric vehicle maker Tesla and social media platform Twitter, discussed artificial intelligence issues and electric vehicles with U.S. Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer on Wednesday.

Title: Elon, or deepfake? Musk must face questions on Autopilot statements
Short Description: A California judge on Wednesday tentatively ordered Tesla CEO Elon Musk to be interviewed under oath about whether he made certain statements regarding the safety and capabilities of the carmaker’s Autopilot features.

Title: Elon Musk meets with Majority leader Schumer in Senate office -aide
Short Description: Elon Musk, the billionaire CEO of electric vehicle maker Tesla and social media platform Twitter, is meeting U.S. Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer in the Democratic lawmaker's Washington office, an aide said on Wednesday.

Title: Tesla broke U.S. labor law by silencing workers, official rules
Short Description: Tesla Inc supervisors at a Florida service center violated U.S. labor law by telling employees not to discuss pay and other working conditions or bring complaints to higher level managers, a U.S. labor board official has ruled.

Title: Tesla broke U.S. labor law by silencing workers, official rules
Short Description: Tesla Inc supervisors at a Florida service center violated U.S. labor law by telling employees not to discuss pay and other working conditions or bring complaints to higher level managers, a U.S. labor board official has ruled.

Title: Tesla raises 2023 spending forecast as it races to ramp up output
Short Description: Tesla Inc raised its capital expenditure forecast for 2023 on Monday as the automaker ramps up output at its factories to take advantage of the rising interest in electric vehicles.

Title: Tesla's California market share tumbles despite aggressive price cuts
Short Description: Tesla's market share in its key California market tumbled in the first quarter of the year despite aggressive price cuts as rivals stepped up, data showed on Friday.

Title: Exclusive-Tesla's Autopilot never claimed to be self-pilot -juror
Short Description: Jurors in what appears to be the first trial related to a crash involving Tesla's Autopilot feature told Reuters after the verdict on Friday that the electric-vehicle maker clearly warned that the partially automated driving software was not a self-piloted system, and that...

Title: US jury set to decide test case in Tesla Autopilot crash
Short Description: A California state court jury began deliberating on Thursday in what appears to be the first trial related to a crash involving Tesla's Autopilot partially automated driving software.

Title: Musk's price cuts show challenge for Tesla's product strategy -Ford CEO
Short Description: Electric car giant Tesla's decision to cut prices to drive up sales volume reflects the pressure it faces from competition and an ageing product line-up, Ford Chief Executive Jim Farley said on Thursday.

Title: Tesla shares sink as Musk signals more price cuts ahead
Short Description: Tesla Inc's shares sank 8% on Thursday and dragged down other automakers after Chief Executive Elon Musk signaled the electric-vehicle maker will keep cutting prices to drum up demand even after taking a big hit to profitability.

Title: Tesla to feel commodity cost pain until second half of 2023
Short Description: A recent pullback in commodity prices will aid Tesla Inc's bruised margins only in the second half of the year, signalling more near-term pain for the electric-car maker which has been cutting prices to prop up sales.

Title: Musk says Tesla likely to launch full self-drive technology 'this year'
Short Description: Elon Musk said on Wednesday that electric vehicle (EV) giant Tesla likely will launch full self-drive technology this year and generate significant profits that offset some of the margin pressure it's facing due to aggressive price cuts.

Title: Tesla settles with engineer accused of taking AI trade secrets
Short Description: Tesla Inc has settled a lawsuit against one of its former engineer, Alexander Yatskov, whom it accused of stealing trade secrets related to its AI-training supercomputer Dojo, according to a filing on Wednesday in San Francisco federal court.

Title: CORRECTED-Tesla reports quarterly margin below estimates
Short Description: Tesla Inc missed market estimates for first-quarter total gross margin on Wednesday, throttled by a series of aggressive price cuts meant to spur demand in a sagging economy and fend off rising competition.

Title: Tesla cuts US prices ahead of earnings report
Short Description: Tesla Inc late on Tuesday further slashed the U.S. prices of some of its Model 3 and Model Y electric vehicles, according to its website.

Title: PREVIEW-Tesla margins in focus as EV price war kicks into high gear
Short Description: Tesla Inc's first-quarter margins are anticipated to have hit a more than three-year low as the electric-vehicle maker slashed prices to lure more buyers in the face of rising competition and a weak economy.

Title: Factbox-Tesla's Shanghai plant, targeted by worker protest, is key hub for EV maker
Short Description: Workers from Tesla's Shanghai factory have taken the unusual step of posting on social media to appeal to Elon Musk and the Chinese public after being told over the weekend that a performance bonus had been cut.

Title: Angry Tesla Shanghai workers vent to Elon Musk over bonus cuts
Short Description: Tesla's Shanghai factory workers took to social media to appeal to Elon Musk and the Chinese public after being told at the weekend about cuts to their performance bonuses, according to online posts and employees who spoke to Reuters.

Title: Factbox-Tesla cuts more prices in a bid to spur demand
Short Description: Tesla Inc on Friday slashed prices of its electric vehicles in Europe, Israel and Singapore, extending a global discount drive it began in China in January while raising concern about its industry-leading profit margin.

Title: Tesla to skip Shanghai Autoshow, organiser's plan shows
Short Description: Tesla will not occupy a booth at China's largest annual autoshow to be held next week in Shanghai, according to plans published by the event's organisers.

Title: Tesla sets up new-energy firm in Shanghai with $2 million registered capital -Tianyancha
Short Description: Tesla Inc has set up a new-energy company in Shanghai with registered capital of $2 million, according to Tianyancha, a company information data provider.

Title: US House committee chair 'concerned' by Tesla deals in China
Short Description: The leader of a U.S. congressional committee on China said on Monday he was concerned about electric carmaker Tesla Inc's dependency on China, a day after the company revealed plans to open a Megapack battery factory in Shanghai.

Title: Factbox-Tesla sets stage for annual shareholder meeting
Short Description: Tesla Inc has put up five proposals for vote at its annual shareholder meeting on May 16, including the nomination of co-founder JB Straubel to the electric-vehicle maker's board.

Title: Tesla to build Shanghai factory to make Megapack batteries - Xinhua
Short Description: Tesla Inc will build a factory in Shanghai to make the Megapack energy storage product, Chinese state media outlet Xinhua reported on Sunday.

Title: Tesla to build new gigafactory in Shanghai to produce energy storage product - Xinhua
Short Description: Automaker Tesla Inc will build a new gigafactory in Shanghai to make the energy storage product Megapack, state media outlet Xinhua reported on Sunday. (Reporting by Josh Horwitz; Editing by William Mallard)

Title: Tesla hit with class action lawsuit over alleged privacy intrusion
Short Description: A California Tesla owner on Friday sued the electric carmaker in a prospective class action lawsuit accusing it of violating the privacy of customers.

Title: U.S. opens safety probe into Tesla that struck student in North Carolina
Short Description: U.S. safety authorities said on Friday they are investigating whether an advanced driver assistance system was in use when a Tesla struck a 17-year-old student that exited a school bus in North Carolina.

Title: Tesla cuts prices in US to spur demand
Short Description: Tesla Inc has slashed prices of its electric vehicles in the United States, its website showed on Thursday, doubling down on a discount drive against the backdrop of a weakening economy.

Title: Tesla lays out five proposals in annual proxy filing
Short Description: Electric-vehicle maker Tesla Inc on Thursday made a proxy filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission listing five proposals ranging from preparing a key-person risk report to re-electing board members.

Title: Tesla to use iron-based batteries in Semi electric trucks and affordable electric car
Short Description: Tesla Inc said it plans to expand the use of cheaper, iron-based batteries to a version of its Semi heavy electric trucks and an affordable electric vehicle.

Title: Special Report - Tesla workers shared sensitive images recorded by customer cars
Short Description: Tesla Inc assures its millions of electric car owners that their privacy “is and will always be enormously important to us.” The cameras it builds into vehicles to assist driving, it notes on its website, are “designed from the ground up to protect your privacy.”

Title: Tesla to warn of data privacy risk from car security cameras in Germany
Short Description: Tesla will warn that its 'sentry mode', which records a car's surroundings, risks infringing data privacy laws in Germany after consumer group vzbv sued the manufacturer for failing to mention this in advertising.

Title: Tesla delivers 88,869 China-made EVs in March - CPCA
Short Description: Tesla sold 88,869 units of China-made electric vehicles (EV) in March for both domestic sales and exports, up 35.0% from a year ago, data published by the China Passenger Car Association (CPCA) showed on Tuesday.

Title: Jury orders Tesla to pay $3.2 million to Black ex-worker in US race bias case
Short Description: A federal jury in San Francisco on Monday ordered Tesla Inc to pay about $3.2 million to a Black former employee after the electric-vehicle maker was found to have failed to prevent severe racial harassment at its flagship assembly plant in California.

Title: Jury orders Tesla to pay $3.2 mln to Black ex-worker in US race bias case
Short Description: A federal jury in San Francisco on Monday ordered Tesla Inc to pay about $3.2 million to a Black former employee after the electric-vehicle maker was found to have failed to prevent severe racial harassment at its flagship assembly plant in California. (Reporting by Daniel...

Title: Tesla shares fall as margin worries overshadow record deliveries
Short Description: Tesla Inc shares fell about 4% on Monday, dragged down by growing worries about the electric-vehicle maker's profit margins after aggressive price cuts led to only a modest increase in quarterly deliveries.

Title: Tesla misses first-quarter delivery estimates
Short Description: Tesla Inc on Sunday missed estimates for first-quarter deliveries as a bleak economic outlook and rising competition outweighed the electric automaker's efforts to prop up demand with price cuts.

Title: Elon Musk seeks to end $258 billion Dogecoin lawsuit
Short Description: Elon Musk asked a U.S. judge on Friday to throw out a $258 billion racketeering lawsuit accusing him of running a pyramid scheme to support the cryptocurrency Dogecoin.

Title: Elon Musk's 2018 tweet on Tesla union campaign illegal, US court rules
Short Description: A U.S. appeals court on Friday said Tesla Inc CEO Elon Musk violated federal labor law by tweeting that employees of the electric vehicle maker would lose stock options if they joined a union.

Title: Tesla's price war: cheaper cars expected to drive record sales
Short Description: Tesla Inc investors are waiting to see how much Elon Musk's price cuts will pay off: the electric vehicle (EV) maker is expected this weekend to report record sales as cheaper sticker prices, helped by U.S. subsidies, spurred demand.

Title: US judge in Tesla race bias lawsuit denies plaintiff's bid for mistrial
Short Description: A Black former Tesla Inc factory worker suing the electric-vehicle maker for race discrimination lost his bid for a mistrial on Friday after claiming the company's lawyers violated court rules by trying to turn jurors against him.

Title: Tesla faces new race bias claims while a separate trial wraps up
Short Description: Tesla Inc has been sued by a Black former general manager who says he was fired for pushing back against comments by his white supervisor that he claims were racist, the latest in a series of race bias cases against the world's most valuable automaker.

Title: EXCLUSIVE-Tesla's Musk planning to visit China, seeking meeting with premier -sources
Short Description: Tesla Chief Executive Elon Musk is making plans to visit China as early as April and is seeking a meeting with China's Premier Li Qiang, two people with knowledge of planning for the trip told Reuters.

Title: Tesla misses big on solar-roof installation targets - Wood Mackenzie
Short Description: Elon Musk-led Tesla Inc has missed its solar-roof installation targets by a massive margin due to stiff competition from GAF Energy and other rivals, according to industry analysis firm Wood Mackenzie.

Title: Tesla expects reduced tax credit for Model 3 by March-end
Short Description: Tesla Inc said on Wednesday a $7,500 tax credit in place since January will be reduced for its Model 3 rear-wheel drive by March 31, subject to guidance due this week from the U.S. Treasury Department on the sources of battery components.

Title: Ex-Tesla worker suing for race bias takes stand in damages trial
Short Description: A Black former elevator operator at Tesla Inc's flagship California assembly plant began testifying on Wednesday in a trial over how much the electric vehicle maker must pay for subjecting him to severe racial harassment by coworkers.

Title: Explainer-Tesla's legal troubles: race bias trial is tip of the iceberg
Short Description: A jury trial begins Monday to determine how much money Tesla Inc must pay to a Black former Tesla Inc factory worker who won a lawsuit accusing the electric car maker of tolerating severe racial harassment at its flagship Fremont, California assembly plant. The case is one...

Title: Tesla faces new race bias trial from employee who had $137 million verdict cut
Short Description: A trial kicks off in San Francisco federal court on Monday to determine how much money Tesla Inc must pay to a Black elevator operator who a jury determined was subjected to severe racial harassment while working at the electric auto maker's flagship assembly plant.

Title: South Korean President Yoon meets with Tesla's Elon Musk
Short Description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol met with Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Wednesday in Washington to call for investment in his country, Yoon's office said.

Title: Tesla wins bid for more details on California agency's probe of race bias claims
Short Description: A California civil rights agency suing Tesla Inc over alleged widespread race discrimination at its flagship assembly plant must detail the investigation it conducted prior to filing the lawsuit, a judge has ruled.

Title: Elon Musk acquires 10,500 Tesla shares worth about $50,000 - filing
Short Description: Tesla Inc. Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk has acquired 10,500 shares of the electric-vehicle maker, worth about $49,665, U.S. securities filing showed on Friday.

Title: Tesla taps Asian partners to address 4680 battery concerns
Short Description: It's crunch time at Tesla Inc, where Elon Musk is looking to crack the code for making better, cheaper batteries.

Title: Tesla 4680 battery’s secret sauce: Dry electrode coating
Short Description: Tesla Inc is pioneering a new battery manufacturing process called dry electrode coating that it is applying to its new 4680 battery cells.

Title: US opens new special probe into fatal Tesla crash
Short Description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) on Wednesday said it is opening a new special investigation into a February fatal crash in California involving a Tesla Model S where an advanced driver assistance system was suspected of having been used.

Title: U.S. opens new special crash probe into fatal Tesla crash
Short Description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said Wednesday it is opening a new special crash investigation into a recent fatal crash in California involving a 2014 Tesla Model S where an advanced driver assistance system was suspected of use.

Title: Column-Tesla hits the brakes but rare earths juggernaut rolls on: Andy Home
Short Description: Tesla will eliminate the use of rare earths in its next-generation electric vehicles (EV).

Title: U.S. agency opens probe into 120,000 Tesla Model Y vehicles
Short Description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said Wednesday it is opening a preliminary investigation into 120,000 2023 Model Y after two reports of steering wheels completely detaching while driving.

Title: Tesla could begin producing autos in Mexico next year -Mexican official
Short Description: Tesla Inc could begin producing its first cars in Mexico next year, with the electric vehicle maker close to receiving its final permits allowing factory construction to begin in Nuevo Leon near the U.S.-Mexico border, the state's governor said on Monday.

Title: CORRECTED-Tesla cuts prices of Model S and Model X variants in US- website
Short Description: Tesla Inc has cut prices of its Model S and Model X vehicles in the U.S., its website showed, days after its chief executive Elon Musk said that the recent price cuts of its other models had stoked demand.

Title: Tesla recalls 3,470 Model Y vehicles over loose bolts
Short Description: Tesla Inc said it is recalling 3,470 2022 through 2023 Model Y vehicles in the United States because bolts securing the second-row seatback frames may not have been securely tightened, according to a filing made public Saturday.

Title: Tesla recalls 3,470 Model Y vehicles over loose bolts
Short Description: Tesla Inc said it is recalling 3,470 2022 through 2023 Model Y vehicles in the United States because bolts securing the second-row seatback frames may not have been securely tightened, according to a filing made public Saturday.

Title: Mexico can't match U.S. incentives for proposed Tesla battery plant, minister says
Short Description: Mexico would not be able to match the incentives offered under a U.S. act to tame inflation if Tesla Inc builds a battery plant in the country, Mexico's finance minister said on Friday, days after Tesla announced the construction of a "gigafactory" there.

Title: Tesla to get over $330 million in tax abatement from Nevada
Short Description: Nevada on Thursday approved more than $330 million in tax abatement for electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc that is set to invest more than $3.6 billion in the state to expand its Gigafactory complex with two new factories.

Title: Elon Musk's 'Master Plan' for Tesla fails to charge up investors
Short Description: Tesla Inc's shares fell 6% premarket on Thursday, after Chief Executive Elon Musk and team's four-hour presentation failed to impress investors waiting for an affordable electric vehicle and a plan with a concrete timeline.

Title: Factbox-Tesla investor day gives a rare look at executive bench
Short Description: More than a dozen Tesla executives took the stage at the company's Investor Day on Wednesday, a departure from its previous such events where Elon Musk tended to dominate.

Title: Musk: 'AI stresses me out'
Short Description: Elon Musk has clashed often with securities regulators and highway safety authorities, but there's one area the Tesla and Twitter chief says the government should regulate now: Artificial Intelligence.

Title: UPDATE 1-U.S. NTSB cites speeding in fatal Tesla 2021 Florida crash
Short Description: The National Transportation Safety Board said on Wednesday the probable cause of a fatal September 2021 Tesla Model 3 crash in Coral Gables, Florida, was the driver decision to travel at high speed.

Title: Elon Musk expected to outline more affordable EV and new Tesla 'Master Plan'

Title: How Elon Musk has missed his targets on delivering affordable cars
Short Description: Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk is expected to lay out details of affordable electric cars at the company's Investor Day on Wednesday in Texas, where he will unveil the EV maker's "Master Plan 3."

Title: Exclusive-Tesla readies revamp of Model Y codenamed 'Juniper' - sources
Short Description: Tesla is readying a production revamp of its top-selling Model Y, according to three people with knowledge of the plan.

Title: Electric vehicle maker Tesla to open office in Malaysia
Short Description: Malaysia on Wednesday said electric vehicle (EV) maker Tesla Inc will open an office in the Southeast Asian country and establish a network of charging stations for its cars.

Title: Tesla plant investment in Mexico worth more than $5 bln, official says

Title: The road to Tesla's first Mexico factory
Short Description: Electric car maker Tesla Inc has chosen the northern Mexican state of Nuevo Leon as the site for its first plant in the country, Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Tuesday.

Title: Tesla's China sales slow as price-cut boost wanes
Short Description: Tesla Inc's electric vehicle (EV) sales in China rose last week but were still running short of the pace seen in the fourth quarter, indicating the bump from discounted prices in its biggest overseas market is waning.

Title: Tesla, Musk sued by shareholders over self-driving safety claims

Title: Mexican president to speak to Tesla's Musk on Monday morning

Title: Mexican president says has call with Tesla owner on Monday morning
Short Description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said he has a call on Monday morning with the owner of Tesla Inc., in an apparent reference to the company's chief executive, Elon Musk.

Title: Musk's plan for a cheap Tesla car is what fans hope to hear this week

Title: Tesla's German plant hits 4,000 cars per week ahead of schedule
Short Description: Tesla's plant in Brandenburg near Berlin is now producing 4,000 cars per week, the company said on Monday, three weeks ahead of schedule according to a recent production plan reviewed by Reuters.

Title: Gerber ends Tesla board run, says carmarker creating 'own voice'

Title: Tesla can't build in northern Mexico if water is scarce, president says

Title: Tesla scales back German battery plans, won over by U.S. incentives

Short Description: The prices of some Tesla models in South Korea were cut on Friday, a local Tesla sales official said on Friday.

Short Description: The prices of some Tesla models in South Korea were cut on Friday, a local Tesla sales official said on Friday.

Title: Tesla shares start 2023 lower on worries over weak demand, logistical issues

Title: Tesla's China head Tom Zhu takes over sales in North America- Electrek
Short Description: Tesla Inc's head of China, Tom Zhu, has taken over responsibilities for sales, service and deliveries in North America, Electrek website reported on Monday, citing sources familiar with the matter.

Title: Tesla's head of China takes over sales in North America- Electrek
Short Description: Tesla's head of China, Tom Zhu, has taken over responsibilities for sales, service, and deliveries in North America, Electrek website reported on Monday, citing sources familiar with the matter. (Reporting by Urvi Dugar in Bengaluru)

Title: Tesla to shorten Shanghai shifts, delay hiring - Bloomberg News

Short Description: Tesla Inc chief Elon Musk has roped in longtime executive and the company's president in China, Tom Zhu, to help run the carmaker's new plant in Austin, Texas, Bloomberg News reported late on Wednesday. (Reporting by Juby Babu in Bengaluru; Editing by Janane Venkatraman)

Short Description: -- Note: Reuters has not verified this story and does not vouch for its accuracy (Reporting by Shanghai newsroom; Writing by Liz Lee)

Title: Tesla's lush profit margin raises sustainability doubts in Wall Street
Short Description: Tesla Inc's eye-popping profit margin has raised doubts among Wall Street analysts if the company would be able to keep at it amid rising commodity costs and higher expenses to increase production.

Title: Elon Musk scores hat trick of Tesla compensation goals worth $23 billion
Short Description: With Tesla's strong quarterly report on Wednesday, Chief Executive Elon Musk has scored a hat trick of performance goals worth a combined $23 billion in new compensation.

Title: Tesla shareholders lose bid for 'gag order' against Elon Musk
Short Description: A federal judge on Wednesday rejected an effort by Tesla Inc shareholders to obtain a "gag order" preventing Elon Musk from publicly discussing their lawsuit accusing him of deceiving them with a 2018 tweet about taking his electric car company private.

Title: Elon Musk's Tesla races ahead of rising costs with price hikes
Short Description: Tesla Inc results surged past Wall Street expectations on Wednesday, as higher prices helped insulate the electric vehicle maker from supply chain chaos and rising costs.

Title: Tesla beats revenue estimates on record deliveries
Short Description: Tesla Inc surged past Wall Street estimates for quarterly revenue on Wednesday as the electric-vehicle maker delivered record units at higher prices.

Title: Judge rejects 'gag order' for Elon Musk
Short Description: Elon Musk will not be subjected to a "gag order" preventing him from discussing a lawsuit claiming he defrauded Tesla Inc shareholders by tweeting in 2018 about taking his electric car company private, a federal judge ruled on Wednesday.

Title: Elon Musk: Don't censor me in Tesla shareholder lawsuit
Short Description: Elon Musk on Wednesday urged a federal judge not to prevent him from publicly discussing a lawsuit accusing him of deceiving Tesla Inc shareholders by tweeting in 2018 about taking his electric car company private.

Title: Tesla resumes production at Shanghai factory, Xinhua reports

Title: Tesla earnings may come under pressure from Shanghai factory halt

Title: PREVIEW-Tesla earnings under pressure from Shanghai factory halt
Short Description: Tesla investors on Wednesday will be keeping an eye on whether the electric car company maintains its ambitious 2022 delivery target as the biggest factory, Shanghai, grapples with a COVID-19 shutdown and new plants slowly ramp up output.

Title: Judge rules Musk's tweets over taking Tesla private were false, investors say

Title: Tesla liable to Black former worker who alleged bias, but payout should be cut -judge

Title: Tesla to open Texas factory critical to growth ambitions

Title: Musk says Tesla will accept bitcoins when miners use more clean energy

The S&P 500 (.SPX)

Short Description: Tesla Motors Co <TSLA.O> and a U.S. subsidiary of Swiss auto supplier Hoerbiger have agreed to settle a lawsuit filed by the electric car maker over problems with a proposed hydraulics system for the luxury Model X's "falcon wing" doors, court records show.

Title: Tesla sues Michigan officials over state bar on sales
Short Description: Tesla Motors Inc Thursday sued Michigan Governor Rick Snyder and other state officials in federal court over the state's refusal to allow the Palo Alto, California automaker to sell vehicles directly to consumers.

Title: Tesla fixes security bugs after claims of Model S hack
Short Description: Tesla Motors Inc <TSLA.O> has rolled out a security patch for its electric cars after Chinese security researchers uncovered vulnerabilities they said allowed them to remotely attack a Tesla Model S sedan.

Title: Mobileye says it warned Tesla against enabling 'hands-free' driving
Short Description: Mobileye NV said in a U.S. securities filing on Friday that its top executives were assured by Tesla Motors Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk that drivers of the company's electric cars would not be allowed to take their hands off the wheel when using the "Autopilot" driving...

Title: Tesla says Mobileye balked after learning carmaker to make own cameras
Short Description: Tesla Motors Inc <TSLA.O> on Thursday said its former camera supplier Mobileye <MBLY.N> disparaged the safety of Tesla's assisted driving technology Autopilot after learning the carmaker was developing its own vision system.

Title: Tesla wins energy storage contract with California utility
Short Description: Tesla Motors Inc said on Thursday it won a contract to provide a 20-megawatt energy storage system at a substation owned by California utility Southern California Edison Co <SCE_pe.A>.

Title: Mobileye says Tesla was 'pushing the envelope in terms of safety'
Short Description: Mobileye <MBLY.N> broke ties with Tesla Motors <TSLA.O> because the Silicon Valley firm was “pushing the envelope in terms of safety” with the design of its Autopilot driver-assistance system, Mobileye’s chairman said on Wednesday.

Title: Chinese man blames Tesla autopilot function for son's crash
Short Description: A Chinese man suing Tesla Motors Inc after his son was killed while driving one of the U.S. car makers' vehicles argues that the responsiveness of the car's "autopilot" function was responsible for the accident, his lawyer said.

Title: Tesla's Musk says new Autopilot likely would have prevented death
Short Description: Tesla Motors Co Chief Executive Elon Musk said on Sunday the automaker was updating its semi-autonomous driving system Autopilot with new limits on hands-off driving and other improvements that likely would have prevented a fatality in May.

Title: Tesla gets $300 million lease credit line from Deutsche Bank
Short Description: Tesla Motors Inc <TSLA.O> said on Wednesday it had entered into an agreement with Deutsche Bank whereby the electric car maker can borrow up to $300 million for its vehicle leasing program, part of a broader effort to bolster the company's finances.

Title: Daimler adopts Silicon Valley tactics to counter new rivals
Short Description: Mercedes-Benz maker Daimler <DAIGn.DE> is embracing Silicon Valley management techniques in a drive to speed up decision making, empower staff and fend off new rivals such as electric carmaker Tesla Motors <TSLA.O>.

Title: Tesla removes 'self-driving' from China website after Beijing crash
Short Description: Tesla removed a Chinese term for "self-driving" from its China website after a driver in Beijing who crashed in "autopilot" mode complained that the car maker overplayed the function's capability and misled buyers.

Title: Tesla posts another loss, but says on track for future deliveries
Short Description: (Editor's note: This story may contain language in paragraph 9 that may offend some readers)

Title: Musk, big investors likely to boost stakes in Tesla
Short Description: Elon Musk and key institutional investors will probably tighten their control over electric car maker Tesla Motors Inc <TSLA.O> after it acquires sister company SolarCity Inc <SCTY.O>, a Reuters analysis shows.

Title: Panasonic to raise $3.9 billion, partly to finance Tesla plant investment
Short Description: Japan's Panasonic Corp <6752.T> said on Friday it would raise up to 400 billion yen ($3.86 billion) in corporate bonds, partly because it needs to bring forward its investment in a Tesla Motors Inc <TSLA.O> battery factory.

Title: Tesla's Musk sees 'modest' capital raise for next strategic turn
Short Description: Tesla Motors Inc's <TSLA.O> next strategic turn could cost the electric car maker "tens of billions" of dollars over the long term, but will likely require only a "modest" capital raise, Chief Executive Elon Musk said on Tuesday.

Title: Exclusive: Tesla, SolarCity close to merger agreement
Short Description: Tesla Motors Inc <TESLA.O> and SolarCity Corp <SCTO.O> have made progress in putting together a deal that will merge the electric car maker and the solar panel installer, people familiar with the matter said.

Title: U.S. senator asks Tesla to brief committee on Autopilot crash
Short Description: The chairman of the U.S. Senate committee that oversees auto safety issues wrote Tesla Motors Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk on Thursday, asking the automaker to brief the committee on a fatal May 7 crash involving its Autopilot software.

Title: Tesla has no plans to disable Autopilot feature: WSJ
Short Description: Tesla Motors Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk said the electric car maker has no plans to disable its Autopilot feature in the wake of a fatal accident in which the driver of a Model S car was using the technology, the Wall Street Journal reported.

Title: Tesla mixes warnings and bravado about hands-free driving
Short Description: Tesla officially touts its partial self-driving Autopilot feature as a back-up to human drivers, but some of the car maker's comments - and some high profile videos - have led many drivers to think of it as a replacement.

Title: DVD player found in Tesla car in fatal May crash
Short Description: A digital video disc player was found in the Tesla car that was on autopilot when its driver was killed in a May 7 collision with a truck, Florida Highway Patrol officials said on Friday.

Title: U.S. opens investigation in Tesla after fatal crash in Autopilot mode
Short Description: A fatal accident in which the driver of a Tesla Motors Inc <TSLA.O> Model S car operating in Autopilot mode was killed in a collision with a truck has prompted an investigation by federal highway safety regulators, the U.S. government and Tesla disclosed on Thursday.

Title: Short sellers ramp up bets against Tesla, SolarCity shares: S3 Partners
Short Description: Bets against both Tesla Motors Inc and SolarCity Corp shares have risen after Elon Musk announced a proposed merger last week, but any further bets will be small as both stocks have few borrowable shares, said Ihor Dusaniwsky, head of research at financial analytics firm...

Title: Chanos: SolarCity deal 'corporate governance at its worst'
Short Description: Shortseller Jim Chanos of Kynikos Associates blasted Tesla Motors Inc's <TSLA.O> proposed acquisition of SolarCity Corp <SCTY.O>, describing it as a "brazen" bailout and "shameful example of corporate governance at its worst."

Title: Musk sees $1 trillion Tesla as shares drop over SolarCity deal
Short Description: Tesla Motors Inc <TSLA.O> Chief Executive Elon Musk said on Wednesday that the proposed acquisition of his SolarCity <SCTY.O> could eventually push the electric car maker's valuation to $1 trillion, but investors disagreed.

Title: Tesla Motors introduces two less costly Model S versions
Short Description: Electric carmaker Tesla Motors Inc <TSLA.O> said on Thursday it would offer two slightly lower-priced versions of its electric Model S sedan, starting at $66,000 in the U.S. market.

Title: Tesla plans to sell $1.7 billion in new stock to fund Model 3
Short Description: Tesla Motors Inc <TSLA.O> will offer up to $1.7 billion of new common stock to finance the accelerated launch of its new Model 3 electric sedan, the electric luxury car maker said on Wednesday.

Title: Tesla taps Audi executive as vice president of vehicle production
Short Description: Tesla Motors Inc <TSLA.O> said on Friday it hired Volkswagen <VOWG_p.DE> executive Peter Hochholdinger as its vice president of vehicle production.

Title: Tesla says it has not finalized 2017 Model 3 design
Short Description: Tesla Motors Inc <TSLA.O> said on Tuesday the design of its new Model 3 has not been finalized, even though the electric car maker expects to begin building the mass-market sedan within the next 18 months.

Title: Tesla puts pedal to the metal, 500,000 cars planned in 2018
Short Description: Tesla Motors Inc <TSLA.O> said it was stepping up production plans for its upcoming Model 3 mass-market sedan and would build a total of 500,000 all-electric vehicles in 2018, two years ahead of schedule, but warned that spending will ramp up in tandem.

Title: Two Tesla executives leaving ahead of Model 3 ramp-up
Short Description: Two top manufacturing executives are leaving Tesla Motors Inc <TSLA.O> as the Silicon Valley electric-car maker prepares to launch its first mass-market car, the Model 3, and sharply ramp up production.

Title: Fiat Chrysler CEO says can build Tesla Model 3 rival if makes business sense
Short Description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA) <FCHA.MI> could build an Italian-style rival to Tesla's Model 3 within 12 months if the electric carmaker can prove the vehicle makes business sense, FCA Chief Executive Sergio Marchionne said on Friday.

Title: Tesla to recall 2,700 Model X SUVs over seat issue
Short Description: Tesla Motors Inc <TSLA.O> will recall 2,700 Model X sport utility vehicles in the United States due to a faulty locking hinge in the third-row seats that increases the risk the seats could fall forward in a crash, the electric car maker said on Monday.

Title: Tesla's Model 3 sedan gets over 325,000 reservations
Short Description: Electric car maker Tesla Inc <TSLA.O> said on Thursday it had received more than 325,000 orders for its new Model 3 sedan in the first week of bookings.

Title: Tesla says parts shortages hampered first-quarter sales
Short Description: Tesla Motors Inc <TSLA.O> said on Monday that parts shortages hampered vehicle production and sales in the first quarter, but the electric car maker still plans to build 80,000 to 90,000 vehicles this year.

Title: Tesla shares surge as Model 3 orders speed past estimates
Short Description: Shares of Tesla Motors Inc surged to their highest in six months early on Friday after the electric car maker said orders for its new Model 3 sedan, its first car aimed at the mass market, had sped past 130,000 in the first 24 hours.

Title: Tesla fans camp out, form long lines to sign up for new Model 3
Short Description: Fans of luxury electric car maker Tesla Motors Inc <TSLA.O> camped out overnight and stood in long lines to put down deposits on its new more affordable model, due to be unveiled at an event on Thursday evening.

Title: Tesla says will 'vigorously defend' plan for second Virginia dealer
Short Description: Tesla Motor Co <TSLA.O> said it will "vigorously defend" against a lawsuit filed by the Virginia Automobile Dealers Association (VADA) that seeks to keep the electric carmaker from opening and operating a second company-owned dealership in Virginia.

Title: Virginia auto dealer group sues Tesla to stop second store in state
Short Description: The Virginia Automobile Dealers Association (VADA) on Wednesday filed a lawsuit against Tesla Motors Inc <TSLA.O> and Virginia state officials to keep the electric car maker from opening a second dealership in the state.

Title: Tesla expects to become profitable in 2016, shares surge
Short Description: Tesla Motors Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk on Wednesday promised investors that the electric luxury car maker will start making money this year, sending the company's shares up sharply despite a wider fourth-quarter loss.

Title: Tesla curbs autopilot feature, but Musk says better than human driver
Short Description: Tesla Motors said on Sunday it was updating the Autopilot driving systems in Model S sedans to put new limits on its hands-free operation, which has been both praised for its innovation while criticized for having been launched too early.

Title: Tesla meets fourth-quarter estimate with 17,400 vehicles delivered
Short Description: Tesla Motors Inc <TSLA.O>, the pioneering electric car maker, said on Sunday it delivered 17,400 vehicles during the fourth quarter of 2015, in line with its forecasts, and a total of 50,580 for the year.

Title: Musk's Tesla faces German battle over battery-powered homes
Short Description: If Elon Musk's vision of millions of households producing all their own power becomes a reality, it will probably happen first in Germany. But he will face a battle for market share against local firms with years of experience in renewable energy.

Title: Tesla unveils autopilot system, but don't let go of the wheel
Short Description: Newer Tesla Motors <TSLA.O> Model S sedans will be able to steer and park themselves under certain conditions starting Thursday, the carmaker said, although Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk cautioned that drivers should keep holding the steering wheel.

Title: Tesla burns cash, loses more than $4,000 on every car sold
Short Description: The Silicon Valley automaker is losing more than $4,000 on every Model S electric sedan it sells, using its reckoning of operating losses, and it burned $359 million in cash last quarter in a bull market for luxury vehicles. The company on Wednesday cut its production targets...

Title: Insight: Tesla burns cash, loses more than $4,000 on every car sold
Short Description: The Silicon Valley automaker is losing more than $4,000 on every Model S electric sedan it sells, using its reckoning of operating losses, and it burned $359 million in cash last quarter in a bull market for luxury vehicles. The company on Wednesday cut its production targets...

Title: Tesla says it sent update for security flaws found by hackers
Short Description: Tesla Motors Inc <TSLA.O> said on Thursday it has sent a software patch to address security flaws in the Tesla Model S sedan that could allow hackers to take control of the vehicle.

Title: Tesla, autopilot crash victim's estate clash over damages in Florida appeal
Short Description: Elon Musk’s Tesla should be liable for punitive damages for allegedly misstating the capabilities of its electric vehicles’ Autopilot system, lawyers for a victim of a fatal crash told a Florida appeals court.

Title: Musk defends his ketamine use as beneficial for investors in new video
Short Description: CEO Elon Musk said his ketamine prescription was beneficial for Tesla's investors in a video interview with former CNN anchor Don Lemon posted online on Monday.

Title: Tesla to increase Model Y prices in some European countries
Short Description: Tesla said in a post on social media platform X on Saturday that it would increase the price for its Model Y vehicles in a number of European countries on March 22 by approximately 2,000 euros ($2,177) or the equivalent in local currencies.

Title: Tesla to raise US prices for Model Y vehicles by $1,000 on April 1
Short Description: Tesla on Friday said it will increase prices for all Model Y cars in the United States by $1,000 on April 1, the automaker said on its website.

Title: Tesla settles race bias claims by Black former worker after $3 million verdict
Short Description: Tesla has settled a long running lawsuit by a Black former factory worker who claimed he was subjected to severe racial harassment, according to a court filing on Friday, as the electric carmaker faces a series of other discrimination lawsuits.

Title: Tesla Germany staff to elect new works council next week
Short Description: Staff at Tesla's plant near Berlin will elect a new works council next week, when Germany's top union IG Metall hopes to gain greater influence at the U.S. carmaker.

Title: Tesla slips as Wells Fargo warns of waning effect of price cuts over demand
Short Description: Tesla shares dropped about 2% on Wednesday after Wells Fargo raised concerns over the waning impact of price cuts by the world's most valuable automaker on the demand for its electric vehicles and downgraded them to "underweight".

Title: Elon Musk says Tesla factory back online after arson attack
Short Description: Tesla's European gigafactory outside Berlin is back online, Elon Musk said on Wednesday, thanking staff for their support after the plant lost power last week due to an arson attack.

Title: Production up and running at Tesla's factory in Germany, rbb reports
Short Description: Production started up again on Wednesday at Tesla's European gigafactory in Gruenheide, Germany, local radio broadcaster rbb reported, after an arson attack on a nearby electricity pylon led to a costly week-long power outage at the plant.

Title: Tesla official talks up Southeast Asia expansion as China's BYD pulls ahead
Short Description: Tesla's expansion into Southeast Asia is a priority, a senior executive said on Tuesday, highlighting the fast-growing market where the U.S. electric-vehicle maker faces competition from China's BYD.

Title: Musk to visit German gigafactory on Wednesday, Table Media reports
Short Description: Elon Musk will visit Tesla's gigafactory in Germany on Wednesday morning after an arson attack on a nearby power pylon last week left it without electricity and halted production, Table Media reported on Tuesday, citing company sources.

Title: Tesla says it will take some time for production at German factory to fully resume
Short Description: It will take some time until production at Tesla's German gigafactory near Berlin will fully resume, plant head Andre Thierig said late on Monday.

Title: Next Autopilot trial to test Tesla's blame-the-driver defense
Short Description: "I got so comfortable under Autopilot, that I ended up blowing by exits because I was immersed in emails or calls (I know, I know, not a recommended use)," said the automaker's president Jon McNeill in an email after he tried out the feature in a Model X. Now the email is being used in a lawsuit against Tesla.
